title: How to Make Pine Needle Tea

steps.title: Put the water into a pot and bring it to a boil.
steps.content: Put the water into a pot and bring it to a boil. [3] X Research source Or, boil the water in a kettle . Use whichever method you're used to.

steps.title: Gather the pine needles, clean them, and then put them in the cup or mug.
steps.content: Gather the pine needles, clean them, and then put them in the cup or mug.

steps.title: Pour the boiling water into the cup while the pine needles are in it and stir until the color of the pine needles starts to pale.
steps.content: Pour the boiling water into the cup while the pine needles are in it and stir until the color of the pine needles starts to pale.

steps.title: For more flavor, add the juice of 1 lemon or a squirt of lemon juice.
steps.content: For more flavor, add the juice of 1 lemon or a squirt of lemon juice. Also try a squirt of honey or stir in a sugar cube. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Filter the pine needles out with a fork and drink up!
steps.content: Filter the pine needles out with a fork and drink up!

steps.title: If you have more time, try this method.
steps.content: If you have more time, try this method. Chop 1/2 a cup of pine needles finely. Add them to the boiling water in the saucepan. Reduce the heat and simmer the tea for 20 minutes. Don't heat any longer as the vitamin C is heat sensitive. [5] X Research source Remove from the heat and allow to steep for another 20 minutes or overnight. [6] X Research source The tea will gain a red tinge. Warm it up to serve or refrigerate if not drinking yet.
